module.name: LazHelpIntf
module.short: Defines base classes used in the LCL help system

descr.p: LazHelpIntf.pas contains types, classes, and routines used in the LCL help system. It defines various base classes that provide the interface for the help system. Many of the methods in these classes are defined as abstract virtual methods, and must be implemented in more specialized descendent classes.
Author: Mattias Gaertner

notes.note:
ToDo:
Fix TCHMHelpViewer descendant.
Make THelpDatabase and THelpViewer components usable in the designer.
Add localization support.
Add Help Editing functions.

element.name: THelpQueryItem.AsString
element.short: Specifies the interface used get a help query as a String value

descr.p: AsString is an abstract virtual String function which specifies the interface used get a help query item as a String value. AsString must be implemented in a descendent class to perform the actions needed to convert the query item to a String value.

element.name: THelpQueryItem.AsString.Result
element.short: String representation for the help query item

element.name: THelpQueryItem.IsEqual
element.short: Performs actions needed to compare the help query items

descr.p: IsEqual is a Boolean function used to compare help query items. IsEqual compares the current class instance to the item specified in QueryItem by calling the AsString method for each item. The return value is True when the string representation for the help query items are the same.

element.name: THelpQueryItem.IsEqual.Result
element.short: True when the help query items are the same

element.name: THelpQueryItem.IsEqual.QueryItem
element.short: Help query item compared to the current class instance

element.name: TPascalHelpContextType
element.short: Enumerated type with values representing Pascal help contexts

element.name: TPascalHelpContextType.pihcFilename
element.short: Context is a file name

element.name: TPascalHelpContextType.pihcSourceName
element.short: Context is a file name for a unit or library

element.name: TPascalHelpContextType.pihcProperty
element.short: Context is a property

element.name: TPascalHelpContextType.pihcProcedure
element.short: Context is a procedure or function

element.name: TPascalHelpContextType.pihcParameterList
element.short: Context is a list of parameters

element.name: TPascalHelpContextType.pihcVariable
element.short: Context is a variable

element.name: TPascalHelpContextType.pihcType
element.short: Context is a type

element.name: TPascalHelpContextType.pihcConst
element.short: Context is a constant

element.name: TPascalHelpContext
element.short: Record type used to represent a Pascal help context and its descriptor

element.name: TPascalHelpContext.Descriptor
element.short: TPascalHelpContextType for the record

element.name: TPascalHelpContext.Context
element.short: String representing the Pascal context

element.name: TPascalHelpTPascalHelpContextList
element.short: Pointer used to reference a TPascalHelpContextType instance

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList
element.short: Implements a list for Pascal help contexts

descr.p: TPascalHelpContextList is a THelpQueryItem descendant used to access and maintain a list of Pascal help contexts. TPascalHelpContextList provides methods used to add, insert, and compare Pascal help contexts in the list. Properties are provided to determine the number of items in the list, and to access individual TPascalHelpContext instances in the list.

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList.Add
element.short: Adds a Pascal help context to the end of list in Items

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList.Add.Context
element.short: Pascal help context added in the method

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList.Insert
element.short: Inserts a Pascal help context at the specified position in Items

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList.Insert.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in Items where the context is stored

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList.Insert.Context
element.short: Pascal context inserted into the Items for the list

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList.Clear
element.short: Clears the Items in the list of Pascal help contexts

descr.p: Clear is a procedure used to clear the list of TPascalHelpContext instances in the Items for the list. Clear iterates over the positions in Items, and sets the Context string for each item to an empty string (''). This allows the record instance to be finalized. Clear calls ReAllocMem to sets the length of the Items property to 0 (zero).

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. Destroy calls the Clear method to remove Pascal help contexts stored in the Items for the List. Destroy calls the inherited constructor to finalize the class instance.

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList.IsEqual
element.short: Indicates if the list is equivalent to the specified list of help contexts

descr.p: IsEqual is a Boolean function which indicates if the current list is equivalent to the list of help contexts specified in QueryItem. The return value is True when QueryItem is a TPascalHelpContextList instance which contains the same context items as the current instance.
IsEqual calls the CompareList method to examine and compare the context items in QueryItem.

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList.IsEqual.Result
element.short: True the lists are equivalent

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList.IsEqual.QueryItem
element.short: List of help contexts compared in the method

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList.CompareList
element.short: Compares the specified list of help contexts to the current instance

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList.CompareList.Result
element.short: Returns 0 when lists are the same

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList.CompareList.AList
element.short: List of help contexts compared to the current instance

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList.AsString
element.short: Gets the string representation for help contexts in Items

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList.Count
element.short: Indicates the number of help contexts stored in Items

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList.Items
element.short: Provides indexed access to help contexts in the List by ordinal position

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList.Items.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the help context

element.name: TPascalHelpContextList.List
element.short: Pointer to the initial help context stored in the list

element.name: THelpNodeType
element.short: Enumerated type that identifies the method(s) available to locate a help topic

descr.p: THelpNodeType is an enumerated type which identifies the method(s) available to locate a topic in a help database. A help topic can be accessed buy ID (unique identifier), Help Context, or its URL (depending the content type for the help database). Each value inTHelpNodeType indicates the combination of access methods available for the help node.
THelpNodeType is the type used for the THelpNode.HelpType property. The value in HelpType is set based on the constructor used to create the help node class instance.

element.name: THelpNodeType.hntURLIDContext
element.short: URL, ID, and Context are valid for the help node

element.name: THelpNodeType.hntURL
element.short: Only the URL is valid for the help node

element.name: THelpNodeType.hntURLID
element.short: URL and ID are valid for the help node

element.name: THelpNodeType.hntID
element.short: Only ID is valid for the help node

element.name: THelpNodeType.hntContext
element.short: Only Context is valid for the help node

element.name: THelpNodeType.hntURLContext
element.short: URL and Context are valid for the help node

notes.note: Used to load configuration settings for the help database. It is an empty implementation in THelpDatabase. Must be implemented in a descendant class.
Used to save configuration settings for the help database. It is an empty implementation in THelpDatabase. Must be implemented in a descendant class.

element.name: THelpDatabases
element.short: Implements support for accessing and maintaining registered help database classes in the help system

element.short: List with registered help database instances

element.name: THelpDatabases.GetItems
element.short: Gets a value in the Items property by its ordinal position

element.name: THelpDatabases.DoRegisterDatabase
element.short: Performs actions needed to register the specified help database

descr.p: DoRegisterDatabase is a procedure used to perform actions needed to register the help database specified in ADatabase. The Reference method in ADatabase is called to increment the reference count for the help database.
DoRegisterDatabase ensures that the Items property contains a valid TFPList class instance, and adds the THelpDatabase instance in ADatabase to the Items property.

element.name: THelpDatabases.DoRegisterDatabase.ADatabase
element.short: Help database registered in the method

element.short: Constructor for the class instance

element.name: THelpDatabases.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

element.name: THelpDatabases.Count
element.short: \Gets the number of registered help database instances in the Items property

element.name: THelpDatabases.Items
element.short: Provides indexed access to registered help database instances

element.name: THelpDatabases.Items.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the help database instance

element.short: Creates and optionally registers a unique help database instance using the specified class reference

element.name: THelpDatabases.ShowTableOfContents
element.short: Displays the Table of Contents

descr.p: ShowTableOfContents is not implemented in THelpDatabases. The return value is always shrHelpNotFound, and ErrMsg is set to the value 'THelpDatabases.ShowTableOfContents not implemented'.

element.name: THelpDatabases.ShowError
element.short: Displays an error dialog for status result codes other than shrSuccess and shrCancel

descr.p: ShowError calls the MessageDlg routine to display an error dialog for status result codes other than shrSuccess and shrCancel. ShowError uses the value in ShowResult to determine the caption displayed on the message dialog, including:

tr.td: Default for status codes other than shrSuccess and shrCancel

descr.p: A message dialog is not displayed when ShowResult contains the value shrSuccess or shrCancel.
ShowError is used in the implementation of the THelpDatabase.ShowError method.

element.name: THelpDatabases.ShowError.ShowResult
element.short: Status result code examined in the method

element.name: THelpDatabases.ShowError.ErrMsg
element.short: Message displayed for the error condition

element.name: THelpDatabases.GetBaseURLForBasePathObject
element.short: Gets a URL representing the base path object for the help databases

element.name: THelpDatabases.GetBaseDirectoryForBasePathObject
element.short: Gets the directory for the base path object in the help databases

element.name: THelpViewer
element.short: Base class for help viewers used in the LCL help system

descr.p: THelpViewer is a TComponent descendant that provides the interface used for help viewers in the LCL help system. THelpViewer provides properties and methods used to access and display help topics using their corresponding help nodes, including a Table of Contents. Most methods are declared as virtual and should be overridden in descendent class that handle specific MIME types.
Methods are provided to register and unregister the help viewer for a specific MIME type. The AutoRegister property controls whether the viewer is automatically registered at run-time.
Use classes like TCHMHelpViewer, THTMLHelpViewer, THTMLBrowserHelpViewer, and THelpConnector for help databases that use the specific MIME types for the respective classes.

element.name: THelpViewer.SetAutoRegister
element.short: Sets the value in the AutoRegister property

element.short: Indicates the storage used for configuration settings in the help viewer

element.name: THelpViewer.AutoRegister
element.short: Indicates if the help viewer is automatically registered at run-time

element.name: THelpViewerClass
element.short: Class reference used to create instances of the help viewer

element.name: THelpViewers
element.short: Used to access and maintain registered help viewers for the LCL help system

element.name: THelpViewers.FDestroying
element.short: Indicates if the class is being freed

element.name: THelpViewers.GetItems.Result
element.short: Help viewer at the specified ordinal position

element.name: THelpViewers.GetItems.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in the list for a help viewer

element.name: THelpViewers.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

element.name: THelpViewers.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

element.name: THelpViewers.Clear
element.short: Frees all help viewers in the Items property

element.name: THelpViewers.Count
element.short: Indicates the number of registered help viewers in the Items property

element.name: THelpViewers.Count.Result
element.short: Number of help viewers in the list

element.name: THelpViewers.GetViewersSupportingMimeType
element.short: Populates a list with help viewers that support the specified MIME type

element.name: THelpViewers.RegisterViewer
element.short: Adds a help viewer to the list of registered viewers in Items

element.name: THelpViewers.RegisterViewer.AHelpViewer
element.short: Help viewer added in the method

element.name: THelpViewers.UnregisterViewer
element.short: Unregisters the specified help viewer and removes it from the Items property

element.name: THelpViewers.Load
element.short: Loads configuration settings from the specified storage for each registered help viewer

element.name: THelpViewers.Save
element.short: Saves configuration settings to the specified storage for each registered help viewer

element.name: THelpViewers.IndexOf
element.short: Gets the ordinal position for the specified help viewer in the Items property

element.name: THelpViewers.Items
element.short: List with the registered help viewers for the LCL help system

element.name: THelpBasePathObject
element.short: Stores the base file path for help databases

descr.p: THelpBasePathObject is a TPersistent descendant used to represent the base file path for topics in help databases. It is used in the implementation of the THelpDatabases.GetBaseDirectoryForBasePathObject method.

element.name: THelpBasePathObject.SetBasePath
element.short: Sets the value for the BasePath property

element.name: THelpBasePathObject.SetBasePath.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: THelpBasePathObject.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

element.name: THelpBasePathObject.Create.TheBasePath
element.short: Initial value for the BasePath property

element.name: THelpBasePathObject.BasePath
element.short: Represents the base file path for topics in a help database

element.name: THelpBaseURLObject
element.short: Stores the base URL for topics in help databases

element.name: THelpBaseURLObject.SetBaseURL
element.short: Sets the value in the BaseURL property

element.name: THelpBaseURLObject.SetBaseURL.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: THelpBaseURLObject.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

element.name: THelpBaseURLObject.Create.TheBaseURL
element.short: Initial value for the BaseURL property

element.name: THelpBaseURLObject.BaseURL
element.short: Represents the base URL for topics in a help database

element.name: HelpDatabases
element.short: Contains the list of registered help databases used in the Lazarus IDE

element.name: HelpViewers
element.short: Contains the list of registered help viewers used in the Lazarus IDE

element.name: CreateLCLHelpSystem
element.short: Ensures the HelpDatabases and HelpViewers variables are initialized for use in the LCL help system

element.name: FreeLCLHelpSystem
element.short: Frees the HelpDatabases and HelpViewers used in the LCL help system

element.name: FreeUnusedLCLHelpSystem
element.short: Frees unreferenced Help databases and viewers in the LCL help system

descr.p: FreeUnusedLCLHelpSystem is a procedure used to free unreferenced Help databases and viewers in the LCL help system. No actions performed in the method when HelpViewers and HelpDatabases are assigned and contain valid class references.
FreeUnusedLCLHelpSystem calls FreeLCLHelpSystem to free and release the HelpViewers, HelpDatabases, and HelpManager instances.
FreeUnusedLCLHelpSystem is called when a THelpDatabase instance calls its UnregisterSelf method.

element.name: FilenameToURL
element.short: Gets the URL with file path information for the specified file name

descr.p: FilenameToURL is a String function used to get the URL value for the specified file name. FilenameToURL calls FilenameToURLPath to get the file path information needed for the URL. The value 'file://' is prepended to the return value to indicate that the file URL scheme is used in the URL.

element.name: FilenameToURL.Result
element.short: URL for the specified file name

element.name: FilenameToURL.Filename
element.short: File name converted to a URL in the function

element.name: SplitURL
element.short: Separates a URL into its scheme, path, and parameter component values

descr.p: SplitURL is a procedure used to separate the value specified in URL into the URLScheme, URLPath, and URLParams output parameters. The default value for these output parameters is an empty string (''), and indicates that the component value is not present in URL.
URLScheme will contain the URL scheme found in URL, and normally contains values like 'file', 'http', or 'https'. It does not contain the '://' characters which mark the end of the URL scheme.

URLPath contains file path information found in URL. It does not include any portion of URL occurring after the initial '?' or '#' character used in parameter values. Those values are stored in the URLParams argument.

element.name: SplitURL.URL
element.short: URL examined in the function

element.name: SplitURL.URLScheme
element.short: URL scheme used in the URL

element.name: SplitURL.URLPath
element.short: File path information from the URL

element.name: SplitURL.URLParams
element.short: Parameters found in the URL

element.name: CombineURL
element.short: Builds a URL using the specified scheme, path, and parameter values

descr.p: CombineURL is a String function used to build a URL using the specified parameter values.

URLScheme contains the name of scheme used in the URL, like 'file', 'http', or 'https'. It should not include the characters '://'; these are appended to URLScheme just prior to URLPath in the function.
When assigned, values in URLParams are included at the end of the return value.

element.name: CombineURL.Result
element.short: URL for the specified values

element.name: CombineURL.URLScheme
element.short: URL scheme to use in the URL

element.name: CombineURL.URLPath
element.short: Path to the file used in the URL

element.name: CombineURL.URLParams
element.short: Parameter values for the URL

element.name: URLFilenameIsAbsolute
element.short: Indicates if the specified URL contains an absolute file path

descr.p: URLFilenameIsAbsolute is a Boolean function used to determine if the URL specified in URLPath represents an absolute file. URLFilenameIsAbsolute calls URLPathToFilename to get the file name used in the URL. The return value is determined by calling FilenameIsAbsolute for the file name. The return value is True when the path to the file does not require resolution of "." or ".." relative path markers.

element.name: URLFilenameIsAbsolute.Result
element.short: True when the URL does not have relative file path information

element.name: URLFilenameIsAbsolute.URLPath
element.short: URL examined in the function

element.name: FindURLPathStart
element.short: Gets the position in the URL where the file path is located

element.name: FindURLPathStart.Result
element.short: Position where the file path begins, or -1 if not found

element.name: FindURLPathStart.URL
element.short: URL examined in the routine

element.name: FindURLPathEnd
element.short: Gets the position in the URL for the final character in the file path

element.name: FindURLPathEnd.URL
element.short: URL examined in the routine

element.name: ChompURLParams
element.short: Removes URL parameters from the specified URL

element.name: ChompURLParams.Result
element.short: URL with any parameters removed

element.name: ChompURLParams.URL
element.short: URL examined in the routine

element.name: ExtractURLPath
element.short: Gets the path information from the specified URL

element.name: ExtractURLPath.Result
element.short: File path information from the URL

element.name: ExtractURLPath.URL
element.short: URL examined in the routine

element.name: ExtractURLDirectory
element.short: Gets directories in the file path for the specified URL

element.name: ExtractURLDirectory.Result
element.short: File path information up to and including the final path delimiter

element.name: ExtractURLDirectory.URL
element.short: URL examined in the routine

element.name: TrimUrl
element.short: Removes leading or trailing spaces in the file path for the specified URL

element.name: TrimUrl.URL
element.short: URL examined in the routine

element.name: TrimURLPath
element.short: Removes leading and trailing whitespace in the file path for the specified URL

descr.p: TrimURLPath is a String function used to remove leading and trailing whitespace that occurs in the file path specified in URLPath. TrimURLPath converts the file path to a file name on the local file system, removes whitespace, and reconverts the file name to a valid URL file path.

TrimURLPath calls URLPathToFilename to get the file name portion of the URL, and calls TrimFilename to remove leading and trailing whitespace. TrimURLPath calls FilenameToURLPath to get the return value for the function.

element.name: TrimURLPath.Result
element.short: File path for the URL after removing whitespace

element.name: TrimURLPath.URLPath
element.short: URL examined in the routine

element.name: IsFileURL
element.short: Determines if the specified URL uses the 'file:' URL scheme

element.name: IsFileURL.Result
element.short: True when 'file:' is included in the URL

element.name: IsFileURL.URL
element.short: URL examined in the routine

element.name: AppendURLPathDelim
element.short: Includes a trailing path delimiter in the file path for the specified URL

element.name: AppendURLPathDelim.Result
element.short: URL path information including the trailing path delimiter

element.name: AppendURLPathDelim.URLPath
element.short: URL path information examined in the routine

element.name: CreateListAndAdd
element.short: Ensures that a TList has been created before adding the specified object instance

element.name: CreateListAndAdd.AnObject
element.short: Object instance added in the routine

element.name: CreateListAndAdd.List
element.short: List instance created or updated in the routine

element.name: CreateListAndAdd.OnlyIfNotExists
element.short: Indicates if the object is added only when it does not already exist in the list

element.name: CreateNodeQueryListAndAdd
element.short: Ensures the THelpNodeQueryList instance has been created prior to adding the specified help query item

element.name: CreateNodeQueryListAndAdd.ANode
element.short: Help node to locate in the list of query items

element.name: CreateNodeQueryListAndAdd.QueryItem
element.short: Query item for the help node

element.name: CreateNodeQueryListAndAdd.List
element.short: List examined in the routine

element.name: CreateNodeQueryListAndAdd.OnlyIfNotExists
element.short: Indicates if the help node and query item are added only when they do not already exist in the list
